Aktivität Welcome!As engineers, we deal with data, measured ... auswählen

As engineers, we deal with data, measured values and signals of all kinds on a daily basis. Many modern methods, for example in the field of machine learning, even rely entirely or to a considerable extent on the evaluation of measurement data! However, this data is often noisy or affected by disturbances that influence the results or even make conclusions completely impossible. But there is a remedy! By filtering the data appropriately, many artifacts can be removed and noise can be eliminated or at least reduced! These skills are essential for engineers and are used successfully in many areas.

This is what we address in this module. Important filters will be discussed and a deeper understanding of signals and systems will be taught so that you are prepared for future challenges. Of course, the module is open to everyone and is also suitable for students outside of process science without reservation, as the concepts can be used in all technical areas.

To make it more fun for everyone and to help you learn, the structure of the module is based on the latest pedagogical standards and principles, relies on active participation and thus promotes a deeper understanding of the content. If you have any questions, please send an email to jackson@tu-berlin.de.

The course "Signale und Systeme für Prozesswissenschaften" / Signals and Systems will start in calendar week 16. We plan to offer weekly tutorials on Tuesdays between 10am and 2pm. The course will be taught in English. The course script, solutions and concept questions are available in English and German. We'll discuss all details on Tuesday 16.04 at 10:15pm in ER-201 (Ernst-Ruska building, seminar room 201 on the 2nd floor).
